text:
After building the webapp using the command "ant" several files are missing or 
broken.

The problem was first mentioned by Lenya L. Khachaturov and then confirmed by 
Martin Polley and myself.

Here is a section of Lenya's mail:

default/live/index.html gives me
An Error Occurred org.apache.cocoon.ProcessingException
Failed to execute pipeline. org.apache.cocoon.ProcessingException:
Failed to execute pipeline.: org.apache.cocoon.ProcessingException:
Failed to execute pipeline.: org.apache.cocoon.ResourceNotFoundException:
Resource not found.: org.apache.excalibur.source.SourceNotFoundException:
file:/usr/local/jakarta-tomcat-4.1.24-LE-
jdk14/webapps/lenya/lenya/content/live/sitetree.xml
doesn't exist.
...

default/authoring/index.html (after login) gives me
An Error Occurred org.apache.cocoon.ProcessingException
Unable to get transformer handler for xslt/simple-authoring.xsl 
org.apache.cocoon.ProcessingException:
Unable to get transformer handler for xslt/simple-authoring.xsl:
org.apache.excalibur.xml.xslt.XSLTProcessorException:
Exception in creating Transform Handler 
org.apache.excalibur.xml.xslt.XSLTProcessorException:
Unable to create templates for stylesheet: file:/usr/local/jakarta-tomcat-
4.1.24-LE-jdk14/webapps/lenya/lenya/pubs/default/xslt/simple-authoring.xsl
...
creator: A.Kuckartz@ping.de

text:
In fact these are two separate problems. There is a workaround for the first if 
the second is solved.

I investigated the second problem a bit and found a recommendation: use xalan, 
('type="xalan"' instead of 'type="xslt"' or default).

The second problem ("Unable to get transformer handler") very likely is a 
problem of the latest Cocoon milestone and head-versions--or more precisely one 
of the libraries used by Cocoon: XSLTC.

These are the relevant Cocoon bugs:
Bug 20084 and Bug 20308

and:
http://www.mail-archive.com/cocoon-users@xml.apache.org/msg27191.html
creator: A.Kuckartz@ping.de

text: Can we consider this bug as fixed?
creator: andreas@apache.org
